articles.title: Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Havana

articles.content:
Floral Baskets to DPRK Embassy in Havana 
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Fidel Castro Ruz, first secretary of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of Cuba, president of the Council of State and president of the Council of Ministers of Cuba, sent a floral basket to the DPRK embassy in Havana on the occasion of the 56th birthday of the DPRK.
 Meanwhile, Minister of Revolutionary Armed Forces Raul Castro Ruz and Foreign Minister Felipe Perez Roque of the Republic of Cuba separately sent floral baskets to the embassy.

Syrian Prime Minister Visits DPRK Wing of Internatl Fair 
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Muhammad Nazi Otri, prime minister of Syria, visited the DPRK wing of the 51st Damascus International Commodity Fair on Sept. 7.
 After looking round the wing, the prime minister said that political and economic cooperation between the two countries is favorably developing, adding that the exhibits in the wing showcase the appearance of the DPRK making progress under the wise leadership of Kim Jong Il.

Palestinian Ambassador Hosts Reception 
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Shaher Mohammed Abdlah, Palestinian ambassador e.p. to the DPRK, arranged a reception at his embassy Tuesday evening to mark the 56th birthday of the DPRK.
 Present on invitation were Mun Jae Chol, acting chairman of the Korean Committee for Cultural Relations with Foreign Countries, and other officials concerned.    
 Speeches were made at the reception.

articles.content:
British Foreign Office Delegation Leaves
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- The delegation of the Foreign and Commonwealth Office of the United Kingdom of Great Britain and Northern Ireland led by Bill Rammell, deputy secretary of State for Foreign Affairs, Tuesday flew back home after winding up its four-day visit to the DPRK.
 During its visit Choe Thae Bok, chairman of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, and Paek Nam Sun, minister of Foreign Affairs of the DPRK, separately met and had friendly talks with the British delegation.    
 The delegation met with officials of the DPRK Foreign Ministry and exchanged views on the issues of bilateral concern and visited different places of Pyongyang and Phyongsong City.

articles.title: Message of Greetings to President of Nicaragua
Message of Greetings to Mexican President
articles.content:
Message of Greetings to President of Nicaragua
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Tuesday sent a message of greetings to Enrique Bolanos Geyer, president of Nicaragua, on its independence day.
 Sincerely wishing the president success in his responsible work for the progress of the country and the welfare of the people, the message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to grow strong on good terms.

articles.content:
Message of Greetings to Mexican President
    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a message of greetings to Vicente Fox Quesada, president of the United Mexican States, on its independence day.
 The message expressed the belief that the friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to favorably develop in the future, too.

    Pyongyang, September 15 (KCNA) -- A delegation of the Democratic People's Republic of Korea led by Vice-Minister of Foreign Affairs Choe Su Hon left Pyongyang today to attend the 59th Session of the U.N. General Assembly.
